overview_of_class: This class examines the economics of government taxation and expenditure policies. Topics covered include externalities and public goods, programs that target the poor such as Medicaid and the Earned Income Tax Credit, and social insurance programs such as Social Security and Medicare.
name: Elements of Public Finance
title: WCAS ECON 309-0-20 Elements of Public Finance

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class examines the economics of government taxation and expenditure policies. Topics covered include externalities and public goods, programs that target the poor such as Medicaid and the Earned Income Tax Credit, and social insurance programs such as Social Security and Medicare.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: This class will meet twice per week in lecture and have regular discussion sections.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Course grades will be based on two exams and regular assignments.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Public Finance and Public Policy, by Jonathan Gruber, any edition is fine (the ISBN of the fourth and most recent edition is: 978-1429278454).

Student response systems (clickers) will be used in the class.

subject: ECON
